result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Bodily Harm or Threat to Employee of Health Care Facility or Family

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randel L Chartier

records.addlTxt:
10:03 AM - cases called - 22CM133, 22CM140 and 22CF152.  Defendant Randel L Chartier in court.  Attorney Jerome Babiak in court for Randel L Chartier.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding status of these matters.  Court questions Atty Babiak.  Responses by Babiak - not objecting to the findings.  Court has reviewed the reports of August 10 and September 27 and receives the same.  Court further finds State waives right to present any further evidence and the Defendant is no objecting.  Court adopts the findings of Dr. Lynch.  Court orders the Defendant be treated under the supervision of the Department of Health Services and if necessary - treated and medicated on an involuntary basis.  Court will prepare the Order.
Scheduling conference scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on January 5, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Sent Competency Order
by Department of Health Services
for Competency Examination
Competency hearing on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:25 AM - cases called - 22CM133, 22CM140 and 22CF152.  Defendant Randel L Chartier in court.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach in court for Randel L Chartier.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding State's wavier.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Court questions Atty Fehrenbach.  Response by Atty Fehrenbach.  Discussions regarding testimony of Dr. Lynch.  Statement by the Court - will adjourn this matter to hear Dr. Lynch's testimony.  Court further grants Atty Fehrenbach's request to have a second evaluation completed by Dr. Lynch.
Competency hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State 971.14(4) Waiver
Competency hearing on August 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Christopher Restemayer appeared on behalf of Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach in court for Randel L Chartier.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response. 1:30 PM - case called.  Defendant Randel L Chartier appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Court addresses Defendant regarding bond.  State does not object to a signature bond.  Court will amend the cash bond to a signature bond with the same conditions of bond.  Defendant directed to contact the public defender office.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with the Victim or the Victim's residence.  No contact with Officer Brost's residence.  No contact with Officer Brost when he is not on duty.

1:36 PM - case called.  Defendant Randel L Chartier appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.
